summary: A government memorandum from July 23, 2019, detailing an observation of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. Epstein reported to the observer that his bunkmate had tried to kill him, was attempting to extort money from him, and had been threatening him for a week. Epstein stated he had only reported this to his lawyer, not to correctional staff, out of fear that officers would not report an assault due to the nature of his charges.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual who reports to the observer that his bunkmate tried to kill him and extort money from him.

persons.name: Bunkie
persons.context: Epstein's unnamed bunkmate, whom Epstein accuses of attempted murder, extortion, and threats of violence over the preceding week.

connections.description: Epstein alleges his bunkmate attempted to kill him, extort money from him, and threatened to beat him up.

events.title: Epstein reports threats and extortion in jail
events.description: While being observed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, Jeffrey Epstein tells an observer that his bunkmate tried to kill him and has been attempting to extort money from him with threats of violence over the past week.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein reported that his bunkmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center had tried to kill him.
Epstein stated his bunkmate was attempting to extort money from him, threatening to beat him up if he did not pay.
Epstein claimed these threats and the extortion attempt had been ongoing for a week.
Epstein told the observer he had not reported the incidents to correctional staff, only to his lawyer, because he feared officers would not report an assault due to the nature of his charges.
